image.altText: Close-up of man

items.synopsis: Former SAS captain and Liberal MP Andrew Hastie has expressed his relief at Ben Roberts-Smith losing his defamation trial, saying the courage of former colleagues in giving evidence against the Victoria Cross winner had "rescued" the elite regiment.

title.children: 'Cold, hard truth': Hastie breaks silence after Ben Roberts-Smith verdict

image.altText: A woman with long, dark hair stands in the Senate with her hand in the air as she speaks.

items.synopsis: Lidia Thorpe told the Senate the then prime minister moved Victorian Liberal David Van's parliamentary office after she alleged he had sexually assaulted her.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe in the Senate accuses Liberal David Van of sexual assault, but later withdraws comments

image.altText: Plastic bags full of meth.

items.synopsis: Federal police have pulled off one of Australia's biggest drug busts, seizing six tonnes of liquid and crystal meth that was hidden in shipments of canola oil bottles destined for Melbourne.

title.children: Charges laid over failed attempt to import $1.7b worth of meth concealed in canola oil bottles

image.altText: A man sits with a young boy in an arcade machine, playing a game.

items.synopsis: Kieren McDowall was killed in an incident at Mineral Resources' Ken's Bore mine site, his employer has confirmed. The death is the fourth fatality in Western Australia's mining industry since October 2022, raising questions about the industry's safety measures.

title.children: Worker killed at Pilbara mine site identified, as industry work safety called into question

image.altText: A young man wears a pink tie-dye shirt and silver necklace

items.synopsis: A mother wipes away tears in a Perth court as the stranger responsible for killing her 23-year-old son admits his guilt.

title.children: Man pleads guilty to killing Jack Kinneen, who died in explosion caused by deliberately lit fire

image.altText: A large burnt out tingle tree with a hole through it in a forest.

items.synopsis: Prescribed burning is in place to protect homes and habitats. But environmentalists say it is putting fragile forests at risk.

title.children: Conservationists say this is what prescribed burning is doing to WA's iconic wilderness

image.altText: Win Bakri Daki and Antony Blinken shake hands sitting at a dark timber desk with a man standing behind near US and PNG flags.

items.synopsis: The United States military is being given "unimpeded access" to key PNG defence facilities, including the joint PNG-Australia Lombrum Naval Base on Manus Island, as part of a sweeping Defence Cooperation Agreement.

title.children: US military granted unimpeded access to key Papua New Guinea defence facilities in new security agreement

image.altText: An aerial shot of a police search in the outback

items.synopsis: A scrap of clothing found by a member of the public has prompted police to re-examine a mine shaft where the body of amateur prospector Ray Kehlet— whose wife remains missing — was found eight years ago.

title.children: Scrap of clothing in mine shaft prompts fresh search eight years after prospector's body found

image.altText: Rachel Olsen

items.synopsis: Authorities are trying to determine the source of an oil spill affecting seabirds that are being pulled from waterways in Perth's south "waterlogged" and "starving".

title.children: Urgent search for mystery Perth oil spill plaguing seabirds

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to supporters at Trump National Golf Club Bedminster.

items.synopsis: Former US president Donald Trump faces criminal charges for the second time in as many months. Here's how his day in court unfolded.

title.children: No mugshot, no cash bond and no talking to the valet: Key takeaways from Trump's brief court appearance

image.altText: A smiling, young woman with long dark hair.

items.synopsis: Simone Strobel's naked body was found in Lismore in 2005. Last year Tobias Moran was extradited from WA and charged over her death, but today prosecutors have withdrawn their case.

title.children: Charges dropped against WA man accused of cold case murder of German backpacker Simone Strobel

image.altText: A large black multi-storey building is pictured as it is being demolished.

items.synopsis: South Korea filed a 44.7 billion won ($51 million) damage suit against North Korea on Wednesday for blowing up a joint liaison office just north of their border in 2020, which highlighted a revival of tensions between the rivals following the collapse of larger nuclear talks between the US and North Korea.

title.children: South Korea sues rival North Korea for blowing up joint liaison office in 2020

image.altText: A split image of a smiling young woman with brown hair, a young man wearing sunnies and cap, and young blond woman hugging a dog

items.synopsis: The NSW Health Minister says while frontline workers train for horrific scenarios like the crash that left 10 people dead on Sunday, those who responded to the incident will need ongoing support.

title.children: Health minister praises 'phenomenal' work of frontline health staff who assisted after Hunter wedding bus crash

image.altText: An anonymous outline of a woman with signs from the Hidden Valley community in the background.

items.synopsis: Two women who watched a home go up in flames when a man set fire to it during a fatal domestic violence attack, have re-lived the moment they tried desperately to save people inside, including a toddler.

title.children: Witnesses tell coroner of horrific moment fatal fire was lit in DV attack

image.altText: A man in a jacket sits on a park bench.

items.synopsis: Peter Malinauskas apologises to survivors of child sexual abuse in state care during an address to parliament, including Ki Meekins, who was taken interstate and sexually abused in the 1960s.

title.children: 'Given me my identity back': South Australian abuse survivor thanks premier for apology

image.altText: a large group of people cheering and holding trans flags on the steps inside queensland parliament

items.synopsis: Previously, Queenslanders wanting to change the sex on their birth certificates had to undergo sexual reassignment surgery.

title.children: Sexual reassignment surgery no longer needed to change birth certificate in Queensland

items.synopsis: Ray Walkden and Ray Jones were first on scene at two of the country's deadliest road crashes in 1989. They say emergency and healthcare workers will need support after Sunday's crash.

title.children: First responders to Australia's worst bus crashes offer advice after Hunter Valley tragedy

image.altText: An instant cooking machine, silver and black, with the commercial name Instant Pot on the front.

items.synopsis: Inflation has buffeted American consumers after a pandemic-fuelled binge on goods for the home, but spending has also moved elsewhere as people are again able to travel, or go to restaurants and shows.

title.children: Instant Brands, maker of the Instant Pot and Pyrex, files for bankruptcy as sales go cold

image.altText: A composite image of piles of dirt next to and Aboriginal man.

items.synopsis: Traditional owners in Port Hedland say they were not consulted before the local council carried out work which allegedly left ancient fossilised footprints "desecrated" and threatened rock engravings.

title.children: Port Hedland traditional owners accuse council, Water Corp of disturbing heritage site

image.altText: A small, propeller plane on a runway in front of a spectacular sunset.

items.synopsis: Regional West Australians say flight delays and cancellations are putting their health at risk as Rex Airlines continues to struggle to provide reliable services.

title.children: 'I will go blind': Sick WA residents missing treatments as Rex reliability issues continue

image.altText: A middle aged woman looks at documents  at her kitchen table

items.synopsis: Elisabetta Di Nardo has been battling with ANZ for almost two years for lending her money she says was based on inaccurate information provided without her knowledge.

title.children: Elisabetta says ANZ failed to verify her home loan application, now she's taking legal action

image.altText: A man standing on his fishing boat

items.synopsis: The charter operator launched the business after helping his own daughter — who has autism — drop a line. But state government changes to what he can catch will force it to close.

title.children: 'I was gobsmacked': A Friday afternoon email signalled the end of Damian's accessible fishing business

image.altText: A woman sitting in the dark.

items.synopsis: NSW Police officers need more training to handle domestic violence cases and should not be allowed continue investigating their own colleagues, a new report finds.

title.children: NSW Police officers need more training to deal with domestic violence cases, report finds

image.altText: CCTV footage shows moment Banksia Hill detainee threw plank at guard

items.synopsis: The Perth Children's Court hears a teen armed himself with a wooden plank weighing about 3 kilograms that he threw at a guard, fracturing his skull during a riot in February, with the disturbing incident captured by CCTV.

title.children: CCTV captures 'mindless act of violence' that fractured guard's skull as Banksia Hill teen sentenced

image.altText: Tom Starling looks into the camera with bruising to his face and blood.

items.synopsis: Police officers involved in a scuffle during an arrest in 2020 of Canberra Raiders hooker Tom Starling, are now under investigation.

title.children: NSW police officers who arrested Canberra Raider Tom Starling under investigation

image.altText: An unidentifiable man in suit in a high rise office, photographed from behind.

items.synopsis: While a 5.75 per cent increase in award wages attracts widespread criticism, a new report reveals the nation's big business leaders are receiving an average 15 per cent base pay rise.

title.children: How much does your big boss get paid? These figures might give you a fair idea

image.altText: Vladimir Putin points his right ring finger upwards as he sits at a table near a mic.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin spends more than two hours giving some of his most detailed remarks about Russia's invasion of Ukraine in months, as the first independent confirmation of the results of Kyiv's counteroffensive come through from the frontlines.

title.children: Putin spends hours speaking on Ukraine war as division between Wagner and defence ministry deepens

image.altText: An illustration of two spiked lizards on rocks, one lizard has its mouth open with a visible navy blue tongue sticking out.

items.synopsis: Its official name is Tiliqua frangens, but its bulky bod and serious spiky armour mean it already has a range of colourful nicknames including "Mega Chonk" and "Chonkasaurus".

title.children: Giant prehistoric skink dubbed 'Mega Chonk' discovered in Dubbo region

image.altText: Sunlight enters Tam Pa Ling cave's steep entrance

items.synopsis: Bone fragments found in a mountain cave in northern Laos are the oldest evidence of modern humans in South-East Asia, suggesting our species was in the region much earlier than previously thought, say scientists.

title.children: Ancestors or a 'failed migration'? Researchers find ancient human fossils in mainland South-East Asia

image.altText: silhouetted coal mining digger next to a dump truck at a coal mine

items.synopsis: The WA government has spent millions of dollars more than it expected to prop up the failing foreign-owned Griffin coal mine in the state's south-west, with the total bill now exceeding $23 million.

title.children: 'An embarrassment': WA government slammed for spending millions to keep foreign-owned coal mine running

image.altText: a young brunette woman smiling into the camera

items.synopsis: JM Lane had been living in Canada since early January and was on a road trip in British Columbia before she was due to start a finance job.

title.children: Canadian police find Brisbane woman's body while searching remote hiking trail

image.altText: Aerial train crash still 1

items.synopsis: Emergency services are responding to the crash about 13 kilometres south-west of the town, where a fire has also broken out.

title.children: Four people injured after freight train collides with truck near Katherine

image.altText: A police car blocks a road.

items.synopsis: Prosecutors allege the weapons expert who loaded the revolver used on the movie Rust, which resulted in a death, was likely hungover at the time.

title.children: Prosecutors accuse Rust weapons expert in Alec Baldwin case of drinking, smoking marijuana

image.altText: A fictional desert planet called Tatooine in the Star Wars franchise

items.synopsis: An international team of astronomers discovers a rare multi-planet system that closely resembles the home of Star Wars hero Luke Skywalker, Tatooine.

title.children: Astronomers discover rare planet resembling the home of Star Wars' Luke Skywalker
